---
# title: "teemi"
---





Teemi is an open-source Python platform for literate, data-driven engineering of biosystems, supporting simulation, structured data capture, and AI-assisted design under FAIR principles. I led its conceptualization and development to streamline the DBTL cycle, enabling scalable, automated, and hypothesis-driven experimentation in synthetic biology. See reference below:

*[1] S. D. Petersen, L. Levassor, C. M. Pedersen, et al. "Teemi: An
Open-Source Literate Programming Approach for Iterative
Design-Build-Test-Learn Cycles in Bioengineering". In: _PLOS
Computational Biology_ 20.3 (Mar. 2024), p. e1011929. ISSN: 1553-7358.
DOI: 10.1371/journal.pcbi.1011929.
<https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1011929>
(visited on 10/28/2024).*
